node.title: Problems of using MOOSE with hip
node.bodyText:
Hello, just the other week I successfully ran a couple of MOOSE cases using MOOSE (HIP) in an offline environment.#27635 (comment)
I was going to try to run my files using hip, but there were some issues and I'm now opening another discussion.
This is the.i file
[Mesh]
  [gen]
    type = GeneratedMeshGenerator
    dim = 2
    xmin = 0
    xmax = 1.0
    ymin = 0
    ymax = 1.0
    nx = 16
    ny = 16
  []
[]

[Modules]
  [IncompressibleNavierStokes]
    equation_type = steady-state

    velocity_boundary = 'bottom right top             left'
    velocity_function = '0 0    0 0   lid_function 0  0 0'
    initial_velocity = '1e-15 1e-15 0'
    add_standard_velocity_variables_for_ad = false

    pressure_pinned_node = 0

    density_name = rho
    dynamic_viscosity_name = mu

    use_ad = true
    laplace = true
    family = LAGRANGE
    order = FIRST

    add_temperature_equation = true
    fixed_temperature_boundary = 'bottom top'
    temperature_function = '1 0'

    supg = true
    pspg = true
  []
[]


[Materials]
  [const]
    type = ADGenericConstantMaterial
    prop_names = 'rho mu cp k'
    prop_values = '1  1  1  .01'
  []
[]

[Functions]
  [lid_function]
    # We pick a function that is exactly represented in the velocity
    # space so that the Dirichlet conditions are the same regardless
    # of the mesh spacing.
    type = ParsedFunction
    expression = '4*x*(1-x)'
  []
[]

[Preconditioning]
  [SMP]
    type = SMP
    full = true
  []
[]

[Executioner]
  type = Steady
  solve_type = 'NEWTON'
  petsc_options_iname = '-pc_type -sub_pc_factor_levels -ksp_gmres_restart'
  petsc_options_value = 'asm      6                     200'
  line_search = 'none'
  nl_rel_tol = 1e-12
  nl_max_its = 6
[]

[Outputs]
  exodus = true
[]


And then this is an error

DId you rebuild since you changed the makefile?
If not, then do that
If so, then there's something wrong with the linked libraries.
so
git clean -Xfd 

CAREFUL: this deletes all unsaved work! Use git add / git commit to save your work
in both moose and your application
then rebuild then NS will work

The output of ldd shows that navier stokes is not being linked in.
Until it is you won't be able to use Navier Stokes object.
When you git cleaned both your app and moose, did you make sure to:

run the command in the top folder
save your modifications to the Makefile before running git clean

node.title: Nucleation at specific location in polycrystal
node.bodyText:
Hello,
I want to know if there is a way I can define (in my input file) that if certain variable reaches a particular value (eg. one of the order parameter say eta, when it is 0.5, or if a concentration variable, c, reaches say a value of 0.5) the nucleation takes place at those regions only. I am using DiscreteNucleationForce but this kernel wants me to act on the reserved order parameter. I am not able to see any module that let me define the condition.
Looking forward.
Thank you
Ashish

Hello
I think this is a use case the grain tracker.
https://mooseframework.inl.gov/source/postprocessors/GrainTracker.html
Guillaume
Thank you

node.title: Outputting the last time step
node.bodyText:
Hello team,
I am using time_step_interval option to create output files at an interval. With this, I noticed that the last time step does not always get written because of the above option. How can I get the last time step irrespective of what time_step_interval I use?

Hello
You can add the execute_on  FINAL option to the output.
So probably set the parameter as execute_on = 'TIMESTEP_END FINAL'
Guillaume

node.title: Error with Flow Channel Scaling Factor
node.bodyText:
Hello, I am working on simulating a case where a pipe splits into 10 pipes, they go through a heated section, then recombine into 1 pipe. What I am trying to do I modify the scaling_factor_1phase for a flow channel 1 phase, however, whenever I define scaling_factor_1phase, I get a terminal error that says: "The variable 'rhoA' has already been added with a different scaling factor.", however, I do not have this defined elsewhere. Below is my current input file.
`# Define regen properties.
L_regen = 1
n_elems_regen = 10
D_regen = 0.005
[GlobalParams]
initial_p = 1e6
initial_T = 60
initial_vel = 1.0
initial_vel_x = 1
initial_vel_y = 0
initial_vel_z = 0
fp = fp

closures = simple_closures
f = 0

gravity_vector = '0 0 0'

[]
[FluidProperties]
[fp]
type = IdealGasFluidProperties
gamma = 1.4
molar_mass = 0.01
[]
[]
[Closures]
[simple_closures]
type = Closures1PhaseTHM
[]
[]
[Components]
[inlet_1]
type = InletMassFlowRateTemperature1Phase
input = 'pipe_1:in'
m_dot = 5
T = 100
[]
[pipe_1]
    type = FlowChannel1Phase
    position = '0 0 0'
    orientation = '0 1 0'
    length = 1
    n_elems = 10
    A = 1
    scaling_factor_1phase = '0.1 0.1 0.1'
[]

[regen_hs]
    type = HeatStructureCylindrical
    position = '0 0 0'
    orientation = '0 1 0'
    length = ${L_regen}
    n_elems = ${n_elems_regen}
    names = 'block'
    widths = '${fparse D_regen / 2.}'
    solid_properties = 'steel'
    solid_properties_T_ref = '300'
    n_part_elems = 5
[]

[total_pwr_regen]
    type = TotalPower
    power = 2000
[]

[regen_heating]
    type = HeatSourceFromTotalPower
    hs = regen_hs
    regions = block
    power = total_pwr_regen
[]

[regen_ht]
    type = HeatTransferFromHeatStructure1Phase
    flow_channel = pipe_1
    hs = regen_hs
    hs_side = outer
    P_hf = '${fparse pi * D_regen}'
[]

[jct1]
    type = JunctionParallelChannels1Phase
    position = '0 1 0'
    connections = 'pipe_1:out pipe_2:in'
    volume = 1e-5
[]

[pipe_2]
    type = FlowChannel1Phase
    position = '0 1 0'
    orientation = '0 1 0'
    length = 1
    n_elems = 10
    A = 1
    # scaling_factor_1phase = '0.1 0.1 0.1'
[]

[outlet]
    type = Outlet1Phase
    input = 'pipe_2:out'
    p = 1e6
[]

[]
[Preconditioning]
[pc]
type = SMP
full = true
[]
[]
[Executioner]
type = Transient
scheme = bdf2
start_time = 0
dt = 0.1
num_steps = 5000

abort_on_solve_fail = true

solve_type = 'newton'
line_search = 'basic'
petsc_options_iname = '-pc_type'
petsc_options_value = ' lu'

nl_rel_tol = 1e-6
nl_abs_tol = 1e-5

nl_max_its = 5
l_tol = 1e-4

[]
[Outputs]
exodus = true
[console]
    type = Console
    outlier_variable_norms = false
[]
print_linear_residuals = false

[] `
Could this error be coming from the heat structure by any chance? When the heat structure is removed from the input file, I get no error, but when it is added, the error appears.

The "different scaling factor" it refers to is the one used on your other channel (pipe_2), which is using a default value that is different from your 0.1 value in pipe_1, so you need to have these match.

If I had a system of pipes, would they all have to have the same scaling factor, or only the pipes on either side of the heated section?
I am curious because only the heated section splits into multiple pipes for better heat flow, but external to the heated sections, the piping is all in one pipe.

Right now, all pipe components, heated or unheated, need to have the same scaling factor. This is because a given variable name like rhoA in the nonlinear system of equations may only have a single scaling factor. There is no ability right now to have that scaling factor differ by block/subdomain. For CONSTANT MONOMIAL variables like we use in THM's flow formulation, this might be possible, but for nodal variables, it wouldn't make since because nodes can be shared between subdomains.
What is your objective in modifying the scaling factor from the default?

Oh ok, I see what you mean. I am trying to modify the scaling factor specifically for heated sections because the total heat generated from the source needs to be distributed between a given number of pipes; without the scaling, the average surface temperature of the pipes do not make sense for the problem I am simulating. Is there another way this could potentially be done in MOOSE? And what would be considered as a CONSTANT MONOMIAL variable - would there be specific components used for that? Thank you for your help so far!

Are you suggesting that the scaling factor is actually affecting the solution? To clarify, the scaling factor gets applied to the equations associated with that variable in the nonlinear system of equations, so in theory it should only affect

conditioning of the linear system
convergence criteria

So it should have numerical effects only, not effects to the governing equations.
If you are trying to change terms in the equations, then this is done elsewhere (let me know if this is the case). If you are not trying to modify terms in the equations and you are seeing solution differences with different scaling factors, it is likely because you are inadvertently changing convergence criteria.
So you have a 2D heat structure, and you want to split the heat between flow channels? What is the physical situation you are trying to model?

Yes, that is correct.; the model is currently set up for heat regen for a nuclear thermal engine. The pipes split off and wrap around the nozzle, gaining heat energy from conduction with the outer surface. We may try using a scaled up area approach for the time being to see how that works. Thank you for your help in clarifying!

node.title: Material properties must be retrieved during material object construction to ensure correct dependency resolution
node.bodyText:
After adding the acc_slip to my ComputeMultipleCrystalPlasticityStress class and compiling successfully I get an error after submitting my script.
Below are  snippets of how I implemented the acc_slip(Accumulated slip) :

    _min_line_search_step_size(getParam<Real>("min_line_search_step_size")),
    _line_search_tolerance(getParam<Real>("line_search_tol")),
    _line_search_max_iterations(getParam<unsigned int>("line_search_maxiter")),
    _line_search_method(getParam<MooseEnum>("line_search_method").getEnum<LineSearchMethod>()),
    _plastic_deformation_gradient(declareProperty<RankTwoTensor>(_base_name + "plastic_deformation_gradient")),

    _eigenstrain_deformation_gradient(

        getMaterialPropertyOld<RankTwoTensor>(_base_name + "deformation_gradient")),
    _pk2(declareProperty<RankTwoTensor>(_base_name + "second_piola_kirchhoff_stress")),
    _pk2_old(getMaterialPropertyOld<RankTwoTensor>(_base_name + "second_piola_kirchhoff_stress")),
    _total_lagrangian_strain(
        declareProperty<RankTwoTensor>(_base_name + "total_lagrangian_strain")),
    _updated_rotation(declareProperty<RankTwoTensor>(_base_name + "updated_rotation")),
    _crysrot(getMaterialProperty<RankTwoTensor>(
        _base_name + "crysrot")), // defined in the elasticity tensor classes for crystal plasticity
    _acc_slip(declareProperty<Real>("acc_slip")),
    _print_convergence_message(getParam<bool>("print_state_variable_convergence_error_messages"))
{
  _convergence_failed = false;
}

void
ComputeMultipleCrystalPlasticityStress::initQpStatefulProperties()  
{
  _plastic_deformation_gradient[_qp].zero();
  _plastic_deformation_gradient[_qp].addIa(1.0);



  if (_num_eigenstrains)
  {
    (*_eigenstrain_deformation_gradient)[_qp].zero();
    (*_eigenstrain_deformation_gradient)[_qp].addIa(1.0);
  }
  else
  {
    // set to identity if no eigenstrain is added
    _inverse_eigenstrain_deformation_grad.zero();
    _inverse_eigenstrain_deformation_grad.addIa(1.0);
  }

  _pk2[_qp].zero();
  
  _total_lagrangian_strain[_qp].zero();

  _updated_rotation[_qp].zero();
  _updated_rotation[_qp].addIa(1.0);

  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < _num_models; ++i)
  {
    _models[i]->setQp(_qp);
    _models[i]->initQpStatefulProperties();
  }

  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < _num_eigenstrains; ++i)
  {
    _eigenstrains[i]->setQp(_qp);
    _eigenstrains[i]->initQpStatefulProperties();
  }
  
   _acc_slip[_qp] = 0.0;


}

void ComputeMultipleCrystalPlasticityStress::computeQpStress() 
{
  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < _num_models; ++i) {
    _models[i]->setQp(_qp);
    _models[i]->setMaterialVectorSize();
  }
  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < _num_eigenstrains; ++i)
    _eigenstrains[i]->setQp(_qp);

  updateStress(_stress[_qp], _Jacobian_mult[_qp]);

   // Update _acc_slip
    for (unsigned int i = 0; i < _num_models; ++i)
  {
    const MaterialProperty<std::vector<Real>>& slip_increment_property = getMaterialProperty<std::vector<Real>>("slip_increment");

    const std::vector<Real>& slip_increment = slip_increment_property[_qp];
      
     
    for (const auto& value : slip_increment)
    {
      _acc_slip[_qp] += value; // Accumulate slip increments from all models for the current quadrature point
    }
  }
}

node.title: crystal orientation/directions
node.bodyText:
Hello,
I am using the update method and bicrystal crystal plasticity model. Before I apply any Euler angles, what are the original or automatic crystal directions for the crystals in each model? I am assuming it is x : [100] , y : [010] , z : [001].
@laagesen
I think @vprithiv  can answer this better
The assumption is correct: with out any user-supplied Euler-angles, the crystal directions are aligned with the Cartesian axes

node.title: Vector time 2nd derivative kernel
node.bodyText:
I am getting the following error when attempting to use the vector time 2nd derivative kernel:  MooseVariableFE: Second time derivative of solution (u_dotdot) is not stored. Please set uDotDotRequested() to true in FEProblemBase before requesting u_dotdot.
What do i need to do in order to get the kernel to function?

You have to access the FE problem from the kernel, in the constructor of the kernel, and do what the message says.
If you grep for uDotDotRequested in the repository you can see how it s done
hello, can you please elaborate on this process? i want to set uDotDotRequested() as true, but i am unable to do so.
Why are you unable to do so? Which object are you modifying?
i modified FEProblemBase.C file, there was a parameter _u_dotdot_requested(false), i changed it to true. is this the correct procedure?

no you have to do this from an object. The object that needs this uses "coupledDotDot" to retrieve the 2nd time derivative and under the hood, _u_dotdot_requested should be set to true.
It's fine for now though

node.title: Nodal boundary conditions via imported CSV
node.bodyText:
Hi guys,
I've been looking at Nodal boundary conditions, unfortunately I couldn't find it any where on MOOSE source page.
So the idea would be this, I have a csv table of nodes and their DirichletBC value, not sure how should I implement this into MOOSE.

As far as I can see, most of the MOOSE BCs require 'boundary', but I don't want this, I don't want to define any surface.

1
My initial idea would be this: import CSV file via PropertyReadFile but the problem with this method would be that I would have to prepare the CSV file with all the nodes in the domain (rather than just the nodes at boundary/surface) + I don't want to impose any value outside the boundary/surface even with 0 value
then use PiecewiseConstantFromCSV to store the value from PropertyReadFile > then use FunctionDirichletBC to impose the BC values, but again FunctionDirichletBC requires boundary name/ID
2
Another more silly approach would be that I generate 100 of thousand boundaries using SideSetsFromPointsGenerator or pre-generate it elsewhere, and assign DirichletBC to each one of them (can be done via an action too).
3
Another method would be to create my own Nodal boundary conditions.
If you have any idea or have implemented this, please let me know.
Thank you!
Kind regards,
Traiwit
I see that there are NodalBC.C and NodalBCBase.C in the source files, which might be useful, I will investigate further

Hello
I think 1 would work out of the box.
Note that you can specify bogus values for all the nodes that you dont care about in the CSV file. The only values that will be used by a FunctionDirichletBC would be the nodes on the boundary. It doesnt query anywhere else, the values would be ignored.
2 will not help you with your memory issues
3 would be the cleaner one, calling the propertyReadFile directly from the BC object. As you prefer though.
Guillaume
Hello, have you found a way to add node boundary conditions?

Hi,
yes, you need to use PropertyReadFile > PiecewiseConstantFromCSV > FunctionDirichletBC

[UserObjects]
  [uobj_pwp_read_AllNodes]
    type = PropertyReadFile
    prop_file_name = 'pwp_atALLNODES_rhoGdZminus10m.csv'
    nprop = 2
    read_type = node
  []
[]

[Function]
  [fcn_pwp_initialCondition_csv]
    type = PiecewiseConstantFromCSV
    read_prop_user_object = uobj_pwp_read_AllNodes
    read_type = node
    column_number = 1
  []
[]


[BCs]
  [bc_walls]
    type = FunctionDirichletBC
    variable = porepressure_L1
    boundary = 'BOUNDSRF_WALLS'
    function = fcn_pwp_initialCondition_csv
  []
[]

node.title: Getting Errors While running tests
node.bodyText:
Check these boxes if you have followed the posting rules.

 I have consulted the Posting Guidelines.
 I have searched the Discussions Forum and MOOSE Framework Troubleshooting and have not found what I was looking for
 Q&A Getting Started is the most appropriate category for my question (trouble installing, beginner user, ...)

Issue or question about MOOSE
Everything was running fine until yesterday. When I tried running a regression test today, I am getting this error: symbol not found in flat namespace '__ZN5neml25Model12set_solutionERKNS_11BatchTensorE'
Make command is showing no errors, but while running tests, they are failing and I see the following errors:

In case it helps solving the errors, during the start of the day, I tried getting Neml2 with the following commands:
cd projects/
git clone git@github.com:reverand/neml2.git
cd moose/
export NEML2_DIR=$HOME/projects/neml2
Please let me know how should I get rid of the errors.
(Optional) code in question / simulation log / errors
No response
Encountering Errors? Please include diagnostic output
No response

Hello
Save all your work with git add / git commit
then git clean -xfd in moose/
then recompile
these symbol not found is probably because an old compiled object is looking for a routine that does not exist anymore, or at least not with this signature
Guillaume
Thanks, that worked:)

Everything was running fine until yesterday

Usually tells us, that you performed an update of some kind. Be it, involving conda update/install and/or git fetch/pull commands.
Basically what you want to do, is start over. That is; git clean -xfd's etc, and rebuild.
Edit:
I am referring to our Staying Up To Date section on our Wiki.
Thank you:) That was helpful

node.title: How to set node boundary conditions?
node.bodyText:
Check these boxes if you have followed the posting rules.

 Q&A General is the most appropriate section for my question
 I have consulted the posting Guidelines on the Discussions front page
 I have searched the Discussions forum and my question has not been asked before
 I have searched the MOOSE website and the documentation does not answer my question
 I have formatted my post following the posting guidelines (screenshots as a last resort, triple back quotes around pasted text)

Question
I want to set a boundary condition, I only have a set of nodes, is there any good way to do that?

Hello
What kind of boundary condition? A flux? Or a dirichlet (set value)? Or a particular equation?
What type of variables are you using inside the domain?
Dirichlet boundary conditions. Nonlinear variable. Constrains the displacement of this node set.
These should both be already doable on a node set. You specify the name or the id of the node set in the boundary parameter of the boundary condition
Only the number of the node is known, and the surface boundary is not defined. Is this also feasible? Like this.

You definitely need to create the node set in the mesh as well.
If you have the ids, it should be easy to create the nodeset.
You can try the ExtraNodesetGenerator
https://mooseframework.inl.gov/source/meshgenerators/ExtraNodesetGenerator.html
